info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 1:08PM EDT until April 6 at 11:13AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio...
Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County.
For the Nimishillen Creek...including North Industry...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Nimishillen Creek near North Industry.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Widespread flooding in southern portions of Canton from Ridge Avenue north to Allenford Drive. Flood waters cut off access to homes along Cheyenne Street and Allenford Drive. Flood waters cut off access to properties on Cleveland Southwest Avenue. Some low lying properties inundated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 02/28/2011.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING
